page.title: 13Corn Mill Hulme Village
page.content: The mill was established in 1965,but it has not always been used as a mill.The last owners used it as a dairy.The mill owners do not play any part in the village life although they supply local farms with feed for livestock.They also supply the general public.They employ five people,four of whom live in the village the other lives in nearby Longton.The everyday working hours are from eight o'clock in the morning to four o'clock in the afternoon.The mill also sells beef and pork. The mill uses old equipment to mix, grind and pack the product.The corn is delivered by the mill's own truck.The working day varies during the summer months.Business is slow but builds up during the winter. The mill owner has 200 head of cattle ,from which he makes a profit by selling them to markets.
